explanation: The bug was that `res` was initialized with length `N`, which is the number of input elements, rather than the number of 7-element groups. Indexing into `res` using `i//7` can go out of range. I fixed the initialization to allocate one entry per 7-element group: `res = [0]*((N+6)//7)` (ceiling division by 7).
fixed_code:
N = int(input())
A = list(map(int,input().split()))

res = [0]*((N+6)//7)
SUM = 0
for i in range(len(A)):
    SUM += A[i]
    if (i + 1)%7==0:
        res[i//7] = SUM
        SUM = 0

print(res)
